A few questions with Pheonix unlock and resetting
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher DS Archive (DS): Monster Rancher DS: General QA: A few questions with Pheonix unlock and resetting
By Sekundes on Tuesday, August 10, 2010 - 11:30 am:

First of all, hello hello, long time lurker first time poster, all that good stuff.

1. I went into the Volcano errantry to unlock Pheonix, but I had to leave shortly after getting the Gold Peach, before I could find the injured Pheonix. When I went back later, I was unable to find the Pheonix again, or any event crystals that related to it. Am I locked out of getting Pheonix permanently now, or do I have to wait until the peach grows back?

2. Does a reset take a toll on monsters in the freezer as well as your active one, or just your active one?

Thanks for taking the time to read and answer!

By Thorr on Tuesday, August 10, 2010 - 04:12 pm:

1) If you still have a peach, you should be able to finish the segment.

2) Unknown. If it doesn't affect Frozen monsters, then there is a sure fire way to save and reload for tournaments...

By VenomousX on Tuesday, August 10, 2010 - 04:37 pm:

I'd really like to know the answer to 2, anyone with a gameshark can check it out?

By Thorr on Tuesday, August 10, 2010 - 05:27 pm:

I have been monitoring some of the cheat code websites to see if anyone actually has found the Action Point stat. So far I have seen nothing. Personally, I don't want to ruin my game experience by cheating, but it would be nice to get some more concrete answers.

By Sekundes on Tuesday, August 10, 2010 - 06:54 pm:

By Cabbage on Tuesday, August 10, 2010 - 07:29 pm:

This happened to me as well. Seems to be a glitch.. However, no
need to worry. A while later, Cleo told me it was about time that
the peach grew back. I went on the Errantry again and picked the
peach, continued to the southeastern corner and the event crystal
appeared.

By XxRisonxX on Tuesday, August 10, 2010 - 09:13 pm:

I did an "unofficial" test of sorts, I guess you could say. lol

I froze my monster, saved and loaded it back up... and went through 4 different combos using the combine items I had.

1st monster = Durahan with a detailed galaxy symbol
2nd monster = Joker with a galaxy symbol
3rd monster = Naga with a galaxy symbol
4th monster = Phoenix with a sun symbol

...may just be coincidence, but perhaps not. I kept the phoenix and stopped trying once I saw the potential drop to a sun.

It should be noted that both monsters had 900+ in 4 stats... both were galaxy potential monsters, both were SS rank and between 3years and 3years 5months old.

Monster 1: Ultimate (Gali/???)
Monster 2: Chaos Dragon (Dragon/Abyss)

The Chaos Dragon was an overdrive monster, though I don't know if that means much. Also, it kept showing the potential arrow pointing vertically on every try. Maybe I just had some bad combining luck?

By Sekundes on Tuesday, August 10, 2010 - 10:03 pm:

Did you do anything that would make a monster good breeding fodder XxRisonxX? Because combining monsters that haven't been raised will result in a lower potential monster, and that may have skewed your results.
